abstract: A modest rally pushed the most widely followed benchmark of U.S. stocks past a previous high set amid the dot-com boom.
snippet: A modest rally pushed the most widely followed benchmark of U.S. stocks past a previous high set amid the dot-com boom.
lead_paragraph: Indications that Federal Reserve officials have become more upbeat about the economy set off a rally today that, while modest, pushed the most widely followed benchmark of American stocks, the Standard & Poor’s 500-stock index, to a record.

byline.original: By Jeremy W. Peters and Vikas Bajaj
